intro: Tripogon calcicola, commonly known as the limestone grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, showcasing its adaptation to alkaline environments. Its inflorescence consists of narrow spikelets, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Tripogon calcicola is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
